short_description: This is a driver function which does LARS.
long_description: This function does linear regression model selection. It has two options: Least Angle Regression (LAR), and LASSO. The variables enter into (or leave) the linear regression model 'one at a time'. For LAR, the algorithm takes at most p steps to compute the whole path, where p is the total number of variables. LASSO may take a few more steps to reach the full OLS estimates.

input_tables.name: InputTable
input_tables.description: Specifies the name of the input table.
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input table.

output_tables.name: OutputTable
output_tables.description: Specifies the name of the output table.
output_tables.rDescription: Specifies the name of the output table.

argument_clauses.name: InputColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the columns of the input table that contain the response and predictors. The syntax of predictor_columns is: {col[,...] | [start_column:end_column]}[,...] where col is a column name and start_column and end_column are the column indexes of the first and last columns in a range of columns. The range includes start_column and end_column. The leftmost column has column index 0, the column to its immediate right has column index 1, and so on. Note: In a column range, brackets do not indicate optional elements. You must include the bracket characters (for example, '[2:6]'). Note: This function can take at most 799 response and predictor variables.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the columns of the input table that contain the response and predictors. The syntax of predictor_columns is: {col[,...] | [start_column:end_column]}[,...] where col is a column name and start_column and end_column are the column indexes of the first and last columns in a range of columns. The range includes start_column and end_column. The leftmost column has column index 0, the column to its immediate right has column index 1, and so on. Note: In a column range, brackets do not indicate optional elements. You must include the bracket characters (for example, '[2:6]'). Note: This function can take at most 799 response and predictor variables.

argument_clauses.name: Method
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies either 'lar' (least angle regression) or 'lasso'. The default value is 'lasso'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies either 'lar' (least angle regression) or 'lasso'. The default value is 'lasso'.

argument_clauses.name: MaxIterNum
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the maximum number of steps the function executes. The default value is 8*min(number_of_predictors, sample_size - intercept). For example, if the number of predictors is 11, the sample size (number of rows in the input table) is 1532, and the intercept is 1, then the default value is 8*min(11, 1532 - 1) = 88.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the maximum number of steps the function executes. The default value is 8*min(number_of_predictors, sample_size - intercept). For example, if the number of predictors is 11, the sample size (number of rows in the input table) is 1532, and the intercept is 1, then the default value is 8*min(11, 1532 - 1) = 88.

argument_clauses.name: Intercept
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether an intercept is included in the model (and not penalized). The default value is 'true'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether an intercept is included in the model (and not penalized). The default value is 'true'.

argument_clauses.name: Normalize
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether each predictor is standardized to have unit L2 norm. The default value is 'true'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether each predictor is standardized to have unit L2 norm. The default value is 'true'.
